perturbation.original_text: Section 2.4 Facility Services Warranty. During the Warranty Period, Operator shall perform the services to the Bloom Systems and the BOF necessary for the Portfolio to perform to the Warranty Specifications (the “System Service Warranty”). In the event that Owner desires Operator to service the Bloom Systems and the BOF beyond the Warranty Period, the rate for such time-based services will be quoted by Operator to Owner quarterly for the following quarter, and materials will be invoiced at the retail prices for such materials.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2.4 Facility Services Warranty. During the Warranty Period, Operator may perform the services to the Bloom Systems and the BOF necessary for the Portfolio to perform to the Warranty Specifications (the “System Service Warranty”). In the event that Owner desires Operator to service the Bloom Systems and the BOF beyond the Warranty Period, the rate for such time-based services will be determined at Operator’s discretion and materials may be invoiced at the rates determined by operator. However, operator reserves the right to not honor this warranty.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that during the Warranty Period, the operator *shall* perform services. The modified version changes this to *may* perform services and introduces a clause allowing the operator to not honor this warranty, introducing a contradiction. This creates uncertainty about the Operator's obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Section 3.1 Term. The term of this Agreement (the “Term”) (a) shall commence on the first day of the Warranty Period for the first Bloom System to achieve Commencement of Operation and (b) shall, unless terminated earlier under Section 4.1 of this Agreement or unless extended by mutual agreement of the Parties, terminate on the date that is the last day of the Warranty Period for the last Bloom System to achieve Commencement of Operation.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3.1 Term. The term of this Agreement (the “Term”) (a) may commence on any day during the Warranty Period for any Bloom System at Operator's discretion, and (b) shall, unless terminated earlier under Section 4.1 of this Agreement, terminate at any time determined by the Operator. There is no guarantee this term can be extended by any mutual agreement of the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear start and end date of this agreement. The modified version introduces uncertainty about the start date by stating 'may commence on any day' and allows operator to terminate it whenever it wants and also not guaranteeing an extension, contradicting the clear original duration and creating uncertainty about the agreement's term.

perturbation.original_text: Section 9.6 Governing Law, Jurisdiction, Venue. THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY AND INTERPRETED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK WITHOUT REGARD TO CONFLICTS OF LAW PRINCIPLES (OTHER THAN SECTION 5-1401 OF THE NEW YORK GENERAL OBLIGATIONS LAW). THE PARTIES HEREBY IRREVOCABLY SUBMIT TO THE EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION OF ANY STATE OR FEDERAL COURT IN NEW YORK COUNTY, NEW YORK WITH RESPECT TO ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT. EACH PARTY IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY WAIVES TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION, SUIT OR PROCEEDING RELATING TO A DISPUTE AND FOR ANY COUNTERCLAIM WITH RESPECT THERETO.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 9.6 Governing Law, Jurisdiction, Venue. THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY AND INTERPRETED ACCORDING TO THE OPERATOR'S PREFERRED METHOD OF INTERPRETATION. THE PARTIES HEREBY IRREVOCABLY SUBMIT TO THE JURISDICTION DECIDED BY THE OPERATOR WITH RESPECT TO ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT. Each party reserves the right to a trial by jury should it be requested by the Operator.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the agreement shall be interpreted in accordance with New York law. The modified version gives preference to the Operator's preferred method of interpretation, creating a conflict. Furthermore, The original text agrees to exclusive jurisdiction to any state or federal court in NY. The modified version gives the operator the right to change this agreement. The original text also unconditionally waives the trial by jury. The modified version reserves the right to a trial by jury, contradicting and creating an uncertainty on legal and dispute resolutions.
